title: poker777
poker777
text: Welcome poker777 package, designed facilitate simulation analysis poker games. Whether ’re avid poker player, researcher studying game theory, simply curious intricacies poker strategy, package offers range tools explore dynamics game.

title: poker777
text: poker_winner function enables determine winner poker game two players. evaluating best hand player comparing , function provides clear outcome identifies ties.

title: poker777
text: poker_balance_chips function, can simulate balance chips players participating poker game. function takes account parameters buy-limits, minimum bet requirements, player buy-amounts, outcomes betting round.

title: poker777
text: poker_leaderboard function generates leaderboards based winners round, well pot bet amounts. arranges player positions displays net amounts won, well number rounds won player.

title: poker777
text: Using create_scoreboard function, can generate scoreboard vectors round poker game. vectors contain information winner, pot amount, bet amount round, aiding tracking game progress outcomes.

title: poker777
text: poker_winner function used determine winner poker game two players. evaluates best hand player compares determine winner ’s tie. ’s can use :
code: library(poker777)  # Define hands for two players hands <- list(c("2h", "2h", "2h", "2h", "3h"), c("4h", "4h", "4h", "4h", "5h"))  # Determine the winner winner <- poker_winner(hands)  # Print the winner print(winner) #> [1] 2

title: poker777
text: poker_balance_chips function simulates balance chips player participating poker game. takes account various parameters buy-limits, minimum bet requirements, player buy-amount, outcome round betting. ’s can use :
code: library(poker777)  # Define parameters buy_in_limits <- c(100, 500) min_bet <- 10 player_buy_in <- 200 bet_n_win <- list(c(20, 50), c(30, 0), c(50, 100))  # Call the function remaining_chips <- poker_balance_chips(buy_in_limits, min_bet, player_buy_in, bet_n_win)  # Print the result print(remaining_chips) #> [1] 250

title: poker777
text: poker_leaderboard function generates leaderboard based winners round, well pot bet amounts. arranges player positions displays net amount won number rounds won player. ’s can use :
code: library(poker777)  # Create a scoreboard pot_wins <- create_scoreboard(c(1, 2, 3), c(5000, 3000, 4000), c(200, 500, 300))  # Generate leaderboard leaderboard <- poker_leaderboard(pot_wins)  # Print the leaderboard print(leaderboard) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   player_no actual_win total_bet rounds_won #>       <dbl>      <dbl>     <dbl>      <int> #> 1         1       4800       200          1 #> 2         3       3700       300          1 #> 3         2       2500       500          1

title: poker777
text: create_scoreboard function used generate scoreboard vector round poker game. vector consists information winner, pot amount, bet amount round. ’s can use : Thank choosing poker777 package. Happy analyzing, may poker simulations enlightening rewarding!
code: library(poker777)  # Create a scoreboard scoreboard <- create_scoreboard(c(1, 2, 3), c(5000, 3000, 4000), c(200, 500, 300))  # Print the scoreboard print(scoreboard) #> <scores[3]> #> Player    | Pot        | Bet  #>  1        | 5000       | 200    #>  2        | 3000       | 500    #>  3        | 4000       | 300    #> NULL

code: @Manual{,   title = {poker777: The Package Determines The Winner Of A Poker Game},   author = {Harsh Jain},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: The Package Determines The Winner Of A Poker Game
title: The Package Determines The Winner Of A Poker Game
text: goal poker777 facilitate simulation analysis poker games. Package can used create scoreboards, create leaderboards, determine winner game 2 players, calculate balance poker chips player’s hands. poker_winner function determines winner poker game based hands two players. evaluates best hand player compares determine winner ’s tie. poker_balance_chips function designed simulate balance chips player participating poker game. takes account various parameters buy-limits, minimum bet requirements, player buy-amount, outcome round betting. poker_leaderboard function generates leaderboard based winners round, well pot bet amounts. arranges player positions displays net amount won number rounds won player. create_scoreboard function used generate scoreboard vector round poker game. vector consists information winner, pot amount, bet amount round.

title: The Package Determines The Winner Of A Poker Game
text: can install development version poker777 GitHub :

title: The Package Determines The Winner Of A Poker Game
text: basic example shows input cards player’s hands find wins round. basic example shows input buyin limits, minimum bets allowed round, amount player used buyin, much bet much won round. output total amount won rounds. basic example shows generate leaderboard using scoreboard vector displays winner tournament descending order along many rounds won much won much bet. basic example shows create scoreboard vector information player wins round much won bet round.
code: library(poker777) # Define hands for two players hands <- list(c("2h", "2h", "2h", "2h", "3h"), c("4h", "4h", "4h", "4h", "5h"))  # Determine the winner winner <- poker_winner(hands)  # Print the winner print(winner) #> [1] 2 library(poker777) # Define parameters buy_in_limits <- c(100, 500) min_bet <- 10 player_buy_in <- 200 bet_n_win <- list(c(20, 50), c(30, 0), c(50, 100))  # Call the function remaining_chips <- poker_balance_chips(buy_in_limits, min_bet, player_buy_in, bet_n_win)  # Print the result print(remaining_chips) #> [1] 250 library(poker777) # Create a scoreboard pot_wins <- create_scoreboard(c(1, 2, 3), c(5000, 3000, 4000), c(200, 500, 300))  # Generate leaderboard leaderboard <- poker_leaderboard(pot_wins)  # Print the leaderboard print(leaderboard) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   player_no actual_win total_bet rounds_won #>       <dbl>      <dbl>     <dbl>      <int> #> 1         1       4800       200          1 #> 2         3       3700       300          1 #> 3         2       2500       500          1 library(poker777) # Create a scoreboard scoreboard <- create_scoreboard(c(1, 2, 3), c(5000, 3000, 4000), c(200, 500, 300))  # Print the scoreboard print(scoreboard) #> <scores[3]> #> Player    | Pot        | Bet  #>  1        | 5000       | 200    #>  2        | 3000       | 500    #>  3        | 4000       | 300    #> NULL

code: buy_in_limits <- c(5000, 20000) min_bet <- 50 player_buy_in <- 10000 bet_n_win <- list(c(500, 5000), c(100, 0), c(200, 1000)) poker_balance_chips(buy_in_limits, min_bet, player_buy_in, bet_n_win) #> [1] 15200
